title: NASA to Host Media Call on Upcoming Air Quality Satellite Launch
summary: Media are invited to a NASA media teleconference 1 p.m. EDT Wednesday, April 5, to discuss the upcoming launch of the first space-based instrument to observe major air pollutants across North America every hour during the daytime.

title: Astrolab to send rover to the moon on SpaceX’s Starship
summary: Lunar rover developer Astrolab has signed an agreement with SpaceX to transport its first rover to the moon on a future Starship flight.

title: South Korea sets record space budget  to bolster industry, develop new rocket
summary: South Korea will spend 874.2 billion won ($674 million) on space programs this year to expand its domestic space industry, develop a next-generation launch vehicle, and bolster space defense capabilities. It is a 19.5 percent increase from the previous year, and the most South Korea has ever budgeted for space.

title: Astra says Rocket 4 development on schedule for late 2023 first flight
summary: Astra is still planning to conduct a first launch of its Rocket 4 vehicle before the end of the year as it scales up production of spacecraft electric propulsion systems.

title: Momentus successfully test-fires thruster on Vigoride-5
summary: n-space transportation company Momentus announced March 31 it has successfully started tests of the propulsion system on its Vigoride tug launched earlier this year.

title: Rocket Report: ULA Centaur stage has an ‘anomaly,’ Virgin Orbit funding is dire
summary: "This is why we thoroughly & rigorously exercise every possible condition on the ground."

title: China launches 4 InSAR satellites and new Yaogan reconnaissance sat
summary: China conducted a pair of launches across Thursday and Friday, sending interferometric synthetic aperture radar and reconnaissance satellites in orbit.

title: Space official calls for China to seize crucial opportunity to establish lunar infrastructure
summary: A top Chinese space official has called for the country to speed up its plans to develop lunar infrastructure or miss out on a never-to-be-repeated opportunity.

title: Virgin Orbit lays off most employees
summary: Virgin Orbit announced late March 30 it was laying off the vast majority of its employees after failing to raise additional funding, putting the launch company’s future in jeopardy.

title: Virgin Orbit To Cease Operations, Lay Off 90% After Funding Failure
summary: Virgin Orbit has informed its employees that the company will be ceasing operations "for the foreseeable future".
